meanings.definition: To count or list items one by one.
meanings.sent1: She was umbering the books on the shelf.
meanings.sent2: The teacher asked the students to umber the apples in the basket.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was umbering the acorns in the treehouse.
meanings.sent4: The detective umbered the clues to solve the mystery.
meanings.sent5: He umbered the stars in the sky, trying to make a wish.

meanings.definition: The act of moving in a slow, steady manner.
meanings.sent1: The umbering of the turtle across the sand was mesmerizing.
meanings.sent2: The umbering of the snail along the garden path was peaceful.
meanings.sent3: The umbering of the sloth made everyone laugh at the zoo.
meanings.sent4: The umbering of the clouds across the sky signaled a storm.
meanings.sent5: The umbering of the caterpillar along the leaf was graceful.

meanings.sent1: Her hair was the rich umbering of a chestnut.
meanings.sent2: The painting used various shades of umbering to create depth.
meanings.sent3: The chocolate had an intense umbering that made it irresistible.
meanings.sent4: The old book had pages with an umbering hue from age.
meanings.sent5: The bear's fur had an umbering sheen in the sunlight.
